Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
https://github.com/KMDLabs/komodo/commit/5e872d8fe8bde48924901db6cb79dc97af1c25fa
Hey guys this is ready to test. 
There are some examples at the top of customcc.cpp that I used to create a game and then malform tx by commenting out vouts and all kinds of stuff until I got validation working so Alright cannot break it with his usual methods. 
Im running out of day here and have some other things to do. Can someone pelase start a chain to test this with. 
For now its just using a block hash. 20 blocks before the first block that exists past the game end timestamp. 
Chain should be in CFEKFEK cluster, be PoW only equihash (for simplicty, it will probably break üòÉ ) 
The cclib has to be customcc. Make the block reward something crazy stupid like a million coins üòÑ So we have every chance to find possible overflows.

Content: 2000 LABS for whoever makes PR to StakedNotary with the correct chain params, and working seed nodes.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
basic steps will be:
1) cd ~/komodo/src
2) git pull
3) git checkout lotto
4) make -j(some number of cores) 
5) cd cc
6) ./makecustom
7) cd ..
8) ./komodod -ac_name=CFEK ..... etc. etc....

Content:
@blackjok3r believe there is something finicky with how StakedNotary handles building cclibs. After doing start.sh I'm getting 
```
{
  "result": "success",
  "CClib": "customcc",
  "methods": [
    {
      "evalcode": 16,
      "funcid": "F",
      "name": "faucet2",
      "method": "fund",

      "params_required": 1,
      "params_max": 1
    },

      "funcid": "G",
      "name": "faucet2",
      "method": "get",
      "help": "<no args>",
      "params_required": 0,
      "params_max": 0
    },
    {
      "evalcode": 17,
      "funcid": "0",
      "name": "custom",
      "method": "func0",
      "help": "<parameter help>",
      "params_required": 1,
      "params_max": 1
    },
    {
      "evalcode": 17,
      "funcid": "1",
      "name": "custom",
      "method": "func1",
      "help": "<no args>",
      "params_required": 0,
      "params_max": 0
    }
  ]
}
```

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content: Mine looks exactly like that

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
```
cd ~/komodo/src/cc
git checkout lotto
./makecustom
cd ..
make -j$(nproc)
./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)
rm ~/StakedNotary/komodo/lotto/komodod
mv komodod ~/StakedNotary/komodo/lotto/komodod
```

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Bar_F1sh_Rel the above should fix it

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
if the makecustom step fails, you'll have to comment out lines 
https://github.com/KMDLabs/komodo/blob/4832c6d283a2f3cb26a72b5096be24d88f9e12b8/src/wallet/db.h#L36
36, 44, 45 and 46 here
